CatDescriptText: Ruth Angell, 1632 Compromise Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I think there is one right now. It might not becomse as sever as the one in the '30s, but at present it is pretty hard to get a job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Angell wearing scarf and three button coat, holding dark handbag and gloves in left hand, standing in front of marble facade with store windows on either side, lingerie display on left, and necktie display with sign that reads "Neckwear 1/2 off" on right
